title: Bushfire Evacuations Underway, Deadly Plane Crash, Google Pays Users $100 Million | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – evacuations are underway across Victoria as the state suffers its worst bushfire conditions since Black Saturday. Two people have died after a light plane crashed on the Gold Coast; Google agrees to pay almost $100 million to users after it was alleged their phones were listening to them and selling conversations to advertisers, and why one European country wants to stop people from working part-time. title: Trump Warns Protesters Against Carrying Guns After Alex Pretti Killing | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump says he wants an “honourable and honest investigation” into the fatal shooting of 37-year-old ICU nurse Alex Pretti, the second U.S. citizen to be killed by federal agents this month.  Pretti was a licensed gun owner who had a holstered gun in his possession while filming an ICE operation. Video footage shows officers removing the firearm from his waistband before shooting him.  Trump has since said “We can't have guns. You can't walk in with guns”, despite the right to bear arms under the second amendment of the US Constitution.  The President also confirmed Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem will not be stepping down, despite claiming Pretti “attacked” agents and “brandished” a gun – allegations refuted in video footage.  The NRA has criticised the Trump administration on the suggestion Pretti should not have been armed. title: Sicily Landslide Forces 1,500 Evacuations As Homes Hang Over Collapsing Cliff | 10 News
description: More than 1,500 people have been evacuated from the Sicilian town of Niscemi after violent storms triggered a major landslide, leaving homes hanging over a collapsing cliff.  Authorities say the town’s plateau is gradually giving way due to water trapped in the subsoil, with footage showing buildings and a car perched on the edge.  Civil protection chief Fabio Ciciliano says affected homes cannot be reoccupied and residents will be permanently relocated.  Italy has declared a state of emergency across three southern regions, as extreme weather causes widespread damage and fuels anger over long-ignored risks. title: ICE To Attend Winter Italy Olympics To Protect US Contingent | 10 News
description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) personnel will be travelling to Italy to help protect US delegations at the Winter Olympics, according to a US embassy source.  The source told Reuters on condition of anonymity that ICE's Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) division would support the US State Department's security service and "mitigate risks from transnational criminal organizations”.   This is a role HSI agents also played at the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, said the source.The news has sparked fierce opposition amongst Italian politicians, forcing Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani to defend the possible arrival of ICE in Italy. title: Germany Proposes Restrictions On Part-Time Work | 10 News
description: Germany is considering ending the legal entitlement to part-time jobs, as the country suffers through sluggish conditions and a shortage of skilled workers.  The government’s proposal would require workers to obtain special permission to work less than 38 hours a week.  It comes after the leading party previously suggested making it harder to call in sick, with the chancellor stating the average German takes 14 and a half sick days.
